UPlot

Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot

Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.fluent

The fluent package implements the MATLAB like embedded DSL interface. Each part of a diagram can be configured in three groups: figure, frame and plot. The Figure class creates and configures the window that the plots are positioned in. Configurable properties include the position and title of the window, as well as the inner position of the plots. The frame styling include legend positioning, axis positioning as well as title and axis labels. The plot settings and creation are implemented with their specific classes.
The interface structure reflects this top-down system with the parameters of the functions forming the interface the following way:

   var fig = Figure.figure()
               .title("My Figure")  // function of figure: configures the figure (window)
               .plot(               // function of figure: adds a plot to the figure
                  FrameStyle.title("My Plot")    // parameter of the plot() function: it acts inside that plot
                            .xlabel("My X axis")
                 ,Line.line(
                      new double[]{0.0, 1.0, 2.0}
                    , new double[]{0.0, 1.0, 2.0}
                    , LineStyle.style("-.")   // parameter of the line: configures the line's style
                               .color("red")) // function of the line style: sets the color of the line
                    
                );
   fig.show();
Author:
Tóth Bálint
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Bar
    Fluent interface responsible for creating a bar plot.
    Category
    Fluent interface to store BarData objects and corresponding styling data.
    Category.CategoryStyle
    Fluent interface responsible of storing styling elements to a Line object.
    Category.ColorWrapper
    Wraps a JavaFX paint object and provides static factory methods to create it from another Paint object or MATLAB string.
    Defaults
    Contains default values for the controllers.
    Figure
    Highest level of the fluent interface in standalone mode.
    Figure.Positions
    Mid-interface wrapper type for the Fluent interface.
    Figure.Tiles
    Mid-interface wrapper type for the Fluent interface.
    FrameStyle
    Fluent interface responsible for setting attributes of the frame that are not related to the plot actually displayed.
    Line
    Fluent Interface wrapper around the data.Line.
    LineStyle
    Fluent interface responsible of storing styling elements to a Line object.
    Log
    Fluent interface responsible for creating a log scale line plot.
    Plot
    Fluent interface responsible for creating a line plot.
    Scatter
    Fluent interface responsible for creating a scatter plot.
    ScatterStyle
    Fluent interface responsible of storing styling elements to a Series object.
    Series
    Stores data for a Scatter Plot.
